com.vernalis.pdbconnector

Class ModelHelperFunctions2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.pdbconnector.ModelHelperFunctions2

  • public class ModelHelperFunctions2
extends java.lang.Object
    Static helper functions for PdbConnectorNodeModel.

    SDR 07-Jul-2016 - Added Support for ListCells in getDataCell(ReportField2, String, String) and getDataType(ReportField2)

    SDR 14-Jul-2016 - Added improved handling of 'null' query returns, and cancellation checks. Added direct return of query results to data table and removed deprecated methods which remain in the deprecated ModelHelperFunctions class

    SDR 15-Jul-2016 - Moved all service requests (GET & POST) to separate Threads to enable cancellation during requests

    See Also:
    PdbConnectorNodeModel2

    • Method Detail

      • getXmlQuery

        public static java.lang.String getXmlQuery(java.util.List<QueryOptionModel> queryModels,
                                           QueryOptionModel simModel,
                                           java.lang.String conjunction)
        Constructs the overall xml query string to post to the PDB Advanced Search web service. The query models are first combined with the specified conjunction (AND or OR) The composite query from the first step is then combined with the similarity query (always using an AND conjunction).
        Parameters:
        queryModels - the query models
        simModel - the similarity query model
        conjunction - the conjunction type
        Returns:
        the xml query string

      • getXmlQuery

        public static java.lang.String getXmlQuery(java.lang.String initialQuery,
                                           java.util.List<QueryOptionModel> queryModels,
                                           java.lang.String conjunction)
        Constructs a partial xml query string from a list of query models and a conjunction operator. The return string is preseeded with an optional initial query string.
        Parameters:
        initialQuery - the initial query
        queryModels - the query models
        conjunction - the conjunction (used only if there is more than one query model)
        Returns:
        the xml query string

      • combineQueries

        public static java.lang.String combineQueries(java.lang.String query0,
                                              java.lang.String query1,
                                              java.lang.String conjunction)
        Method to combine two queries with a specified conjunction (AND or OR). No validation of queries or conjunction is undertaken
        Parameters:
        query0 - The first query
        query1 - The second query
        conjunction - AND / OR (NB Needs to be in the full Properties.CONJUNCTION_AND or Properties.CONJUNCTION_OR form)
        Returns:
        The combined query

      • getDataType

        public static org.knime.core.data.DataType getDataType(ReportField2 field)
        Gets the KNIME data type for a given ReportField type. Performs dynamic check that Smiles support is available in KNIME. If so, SMILES report fields are returned as Smiles DataType, else returned as StringCell DataType.
        Parameters:
        field - the report field
        Returns:
        the KNIME data type

      • getDataCell

        public static org.knime.core.data.DataCell getDataCell(ReportField2 field,
                                                       java.lang.String fieldValue,
                                                       java.lang.String urlSuffix)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       XmlDataParsingException
        Gets the KNIME data cell for a given report field value. If field or field value is null or empty, returns MissingCell. Else attempts to convert the field value string to the appropriately typed data cell value.
        Parameters:
        field - the report field
        fieldValue - the field value (as a string)
        urlSuffix - the url suffix (for PNG_URL fields only)
        structureID -
        Returns:
        the KNIME data cell
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an error with the returned data which cannot be recovered
        XmlDataParsingException - If there is an error converting the data to the returned type
        java.lang.Exception - if field value is invalid

      • postQuery

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> postQuery(java.lang.String xml)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. Only used by test query button. Other implementations should use the more memory-efficient postQueryToTable(String, BufferedDataContainer, ExecutionMonitor) method
        Posts an XML query string to the PDB Advanced Search RESTful web service.
        Parameters:
        xml - the xml query string to post
        Returns:
        the result as a list of strings, one per line of output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        See Also:
        postQueryToTable(String, BufferedDataContainer, ExecutionMonitor)

      • postQueryToTable

        public static long postQueryToTable(java.lang.String xml,
                                    org.knime.core.node.BufferedDataContainer bdc,
                                    org.knime.core.node.ExecutionMonitor exec)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.knime.core.node.CanceledExecutionException,
                                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                    java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        Posts an XML query string to the PDB Advanced Search RESTful web service.

        This method adds the result directly to a buffered data container to avoid potential storage issues for long queries

        Parameters:
        xml - The XML Query to post
        bdc - The data container to add the output to
        exec - The execution context
        Returns:
        The number of hit rows added to the table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was a problem accessing the server
        org.knime.core.node.CanceledExecutionException - If the use cancels the query
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • postCustomReportXml3

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> postCustomReportXml3(java.util.List<java.lang.String> pdbIds,
                                                                                                                    java.util.List<ReportField2> selected,
                                                                                                                    ReportField2 primaryOnly,
                                                                                                                    org.knime.core.node.ExecutionMonitor exec)
                                                                                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the custom report in XML format from the PDB Custom Report RESTful web service, using a POST call. The custom report is returned as a list of list of field values, where the inner list represents a single report row (one PDB ID), and the outer list represents all PDB IDs.

        Note: this is the preferred PDB custom report parser at present. It uses a crude, bespoke parser that assumes:

        1. there is one XML element per line
        2. fixed XML element names for root, dataset and record elements (as defined in PdbConnectorConfig)
        3. all other XML elements are field values

        WARNING: This code is vulnerable to any change in the PDB Custom Report output format.

        Parameters:
        pdbIds - the list of PDB IDs to generate report for
        selected - the selected report fields to include in the report
        primaryOnly - pseudo report field to control &primaryOnly=1 suffix for primary citations
        exec -
        Returns:
        the custom report
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception
        See Also:
        #getCustomReportXml2}

      • getCustomReportXml3

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>>> getCustomReportXml3(java.util.List<java.lang.String> pdbIds,
                                                                                                                   java.util.List<ReportField2> selected,
                                                                                                                   ReportField2 primaryOnly,
                                                                                                                   org.knime.core.node.ExecutionMonitor exec)
                                                                                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets the custom report in XML format from the PDB Custom Report RESTful web service, using a GET call. The custom report is returned as a list of list of field values, where the inner list represents a single report row (one PDB ID), and the outer list represents all PDB IDs.

        Note: this is the preferred PDB custom report parser at present. It uses a crude, bespoke parser that assumes:

        1. there is one XML element per line
        2. fixed XML element names for root, dataset and record elements (as defined in PdbConnectorConfig)
        3. all other XML elements are field values

        WARNING: This code is vulnerable to any change in the PDB Custom Report output format.

        Parameters:
        pdbIds - the list of PDB IDs to generate report for
        selected - the selected report fields to include in the report
        primaryOnly - pseudo report field to control &primaryOnly=1 suffix for primary citations
        exec -
        Returns:
        the custom report
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the exception
        See Also:
        #postCustomReportXml2}
